intro: Acetosella asinina, commonly known as the mouse-ear chickweed, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clusters of tiny white flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinctive shape resembling a mouse's ear, giving it its common name. Acetosella asinina is also known for its ability to spread through rhizomes, forming dense mats in suitable habitats.
